li.onclick: openModalInline("Important Message from the Superintendent - Schools Closed Until... (click to read more)", 650, 500, "#article-details-7999" )

span.b: Important Message from the Superintendent - Schools Closed Until... (click to read more)

div.p: Please click the link below regarding Employee Rights

div.h3: Important Message from the Superintendent - Schools Closed Until May 15, 2020

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: Dear Parents, Staff, and Community Members,

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: I cant believe that it has been over a month since we last welcomed our students into our schools. These past few weeks have been the most difficult weeks most of us have ever faced.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: While I will periodically send you updates that are relevant to our school and community, I do so with the understanding that much of the information and the importance of it pales in comparison to what some of you may be dealing with. I have been in touch with many community and staff members who have been so deeply affected by this crisis, and my thoughts and good wishes are with all of those families first and foremost.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: In addition to knowing many so many families who have been impacted so tragically by this crisis, I also understand, as a father of 4, the emotionaldamage of this crisis due to the experiences that our children may be missing out on. I can directly relate to our recent grads who have had their college semestercut short and have been home since, or those seniors who are so devastated about the path their last year of HS has taken, or the 2nd, 5th, and 8th graders who just want another chance to see their teachers and friends before moving on to a new school, and those who worked all winter to get ready for their Spring sport. There isn't a person who hasn't been impacted in some way by this at some level.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: Giventhat, here are a few updates:

ul.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

li.p: Yesterday, Governor Cuomo extended the school closing until May 15.
Last week, as the HS students already know, NYSED cancelled all June Regents exams.
There is still no date set yet for the annual budget vote.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: As the calendar moves closer to June, I am sure you are all speculating about the events that we look forward to in our schools, such as moving up ceremonies, graduation, prom, etc. While I dont have specific answers on those events, I want you to know that these things are on my mind as well. The question that has to be asked is whether or not these events can take place safely, and if so, what will they look like? I would say that while none of us know the actual answer, I think its safe to say that if any of these events take place, they will probably not look like normal. Any decision on these events is at least several weeks away, as we need more time to make an informed decision. In addition, any final decision would need to take into account the current Federal and State guidelines on social distancing and gatherings. All I can do is ask for your patience as we wait things out some more. The event that I will be prioritizing as decisions are made is certainly HS graduation. I will consider any and all scenarios in order to honor our graduates.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: While it does appear that the protocols and sacrifices we have made as a community and a nation are working, and flattening the curve, it doesnt take away that many of our community members will be forever impacted by this. So I encourage you all to keep that in perspective when we start to feel bad about things we are losing out on.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: I believe wholeheartedly that this will end, and when it does, we can be proud that we worked together for the greater good. I also want to believe that when this ends, we will come out of it as better people, and that we will learn to appreciate the little things in life, we will focus onwhat is really important, and we will bemore kind to people. Otherwise, it will mean we didn't learn anything from it.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.p: Again, I thank you all for your trust and patience as we deal with this crisis together. Please be safe, and I cant wait until we can all be together in the schools once again.

p.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;
font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400;

div.h3: May 19, 2020 Annual District Election Has Been Postponed
div.div:
Under Executive Order, all library and school board elections have been postponed until at least June 1, 2020. This also postpones the circulation, filing and collection of candidate petitions.
We will update the website when we receive further information.
